page.title: 12ANCIENT SITES.
page.content: The main historical remains in the area are{PARK HOUSE,}the{BRONZE AGE {CAIRN,}and{GRANTS TOWER.} {JOHN KAY} was born at Park House in 1704 and invented the{flying {shuttle}in 1733. {The BRONZE AGE CAIRN}is commonly known as Whitelow Hillock. Archeologists stripped the cairn of its turf and found burial pits, urns and bones. {GRANTS TOWER}was erected in 1828 to mark the arrival of the Grants in Bury. In the Second World War the tower was used as a look-out post. The tower collapsed in 1944 due to lack of adequate maintenance.
